title: Creating a new Keen fangame
content:
Hello everyone. I'm new to those Commander Keen forums and I feel like I should have joined years ago, as this seems a pretty active Keen forum!

Well, I just wanted to let everyone know here I'm creating a new Commander Keen fangame in Multimedia Fusion. The short name for it is Keen:Return, the long name is Keen: Return to Gnosticus (I wanna change the Gnosticus in there!), and it's a game about the bounders having become mad on the planet in Keen4.

Don't worry, this fangame won't suck, as I am pretty good with MMF and certainly don't use the sucky standard movements. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

The game will feature the SMF ripped music too (those sound closest to the originals!), and *maybe* some remixes. I'll do my best on the movement / gameplay stuff too. And of course, all original graphics, which I hope to add some of my own graphics too (but ONLY if they fit). In short, I hope this will play just like a Keen4/5/6 game, but more extended. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

No screenshots or other stuff yet, not even a RELEASE DATE as I just started it out a few days ago.

Okay then. Soo hello again. Hope I'll be welcome here. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]


LATE EDIT
I thought I should just tell you people I'm in an amateur non-profit games creating team called The Black Wizards Soft.

Our site is [url=http://Blackwizards.sitesled.com/]over here[/url].
But news on my game is put more often on my own site (see profile) and, of course, this topic.

title: Re: Creating a new Keen fangame
content:
Hello, and welcome. You definitely should have some art of your own, in the game. Otherwise you could make a Keen 4 mod. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] Nice idea though.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Hooray!
content:
Welcomage, says I. Great to hear yet another project is in the works. It takes a lot of effort to make a decent Keen fangame, but it sounds like you know what you're doing. Already I'm liking the sound of the non-default movements.

Good luck with it, and keep us posted. And once again, welcome. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Hooray!
content:
Keen: Return to Gnosticus *IV*? I think that's what you mean, lol.

So, got a storyline?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Hooray!
content:
I left the IV out, because it makes the name sound even more like a bad B-movie. :P Seriously, I need a better name, I'll probably just take a

The platform engine is going pretty bad at the moment. I got variable jump heights to work (jump heigher when you keep the key pressed), but when Keen jumps against a ceiling he keeps hanging on it. Gonna restart the platform thing again. Honestly, I'm not too good with custom platform movement, so I keep improving and I'll get it eventually.

@KeenRush: Don't worry. This is going to be too different to make it a Keen mod. And with different I mean: about the same game gameplay, but the game's extended, has more stuff in the menus, has a pretty big intro and more. Just modding couldn't go that far.
And of course, it plays in Windows. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]


EDIT: Sorry if I ramble.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: tips
content:
Hi , nice to see some one from the netherlands again [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] (or at least that's what your profile is saying)
I have a few tips

1- If this is your first attempt to make a game start small , first get used to mmf and make some simple games , if you don't your only gonna feel disappointed if it ends up crappy , I know this from experience I remade my game like 3-4 times , before I stoped because I was disappointed .

2-Don't think of making the game in like 3 episodes if you don't finish the first episode your only gonna feel more disappointed , I know this from experience too .

3-Don't rush things if you do you can get bad quality

4-Work things out on paper first . This can save a lot of time if you are not sure that that idea is gonna work .

I hope that these tips can help you [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v177/memsys/sig-png.png[/img] [url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/os/type/0/memsys.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: tips
content:
1- Hey, don't worry. I've been using MMF for over two years and before that I had another two years of experience using KnP/TGF. I know what I'm doing when creating games.

2- It's gonna be ONE episode with ONE story, I could never handle the power of making THREE of these games.

3- I'm a perfectionist and like to take the time for stuff, so that's ok too.

4- Hey, that's actually a very good idea! Working out a storyboard, the levels, etcetera...


Btw, if you wanna know what I've made before you can always check out my website. There are some games on there. Old, but still. :P

/me runs off to go continue creating K:R (the REALLY short name XD)___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

content:

Dont try to make it TOO perfect cos it can be a pain in the ass .

[quote]Quote:[hr]4- Hey, that's actually a very good idea! Working out a storyboard, the levels, etcetera...[hr][/quote]
I know even the pro's do it , and if mmf crashes you still got it om paper .

If you want I can send you my game

Oh and sorry if i was a bit mean when I wrote that it was 2a.m and I'm sick .[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v177/memsys/sig-png.png[/img] [url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/os/type/0/memsys.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: tips
content:
I'll use this thread as a progress log to keep you people informed on how it is going. Yes, I take THAT much effort. To make a log and post it here.


~ Keen:Return ~
~ Progress log ~
I decided to pick up the old Keen fangame I was creating. This time, I intend to FINISH it.


18 February 2006
GENERAL: Deleted most frames. I need to restart!
GENERAL: Found some new resources.
ENGINE: Removed jumping system, it was too buggy.


21 February
ENGINE: Tried to make a new movement system. Unfortunately, it was as buggy as the previous one.


22 February
ENGINE: Remade the movement system AGAIN. Wow, it works like a charm now! With variable jump height! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
GRAPHICS: Added Keen animations for looking up, ducking and some more. I also improved the older animation frames (they were JPEG'd, got clean graphics now).
ENGINE: Added collision and the ability to get items.
ENGINE: Made the basics of hanging.



And a screenshot:
[img]http://www.sitesled.com/members/davince/Temp/images/KR-screen1.PNG[/img]


EDIT: Okay, how do you use tags here to make text bold and italic and to show an image?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oops.gif[/img]

EDIT 2: Ah, I usd tags before, but they only work when selecting ezCodes.___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: tips
content:
Don't worry, memsys, those grey blocks are made to be off-screen and are only on-screen for testing purposes. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
And the bottom brown ground? That has changed already. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

NEW SCREENSHOTS!
[img]http://www.sitesled.com/members/davince/Temp/images/KRscreen2.PNG[/img]


23 February 2006
ENGINE
- Added world map movement.
- Added map switching / entering (+ animation).
- Made jumping smoother and collision better. Removed movement bugs.
- Added pogo! Works smooth and goes higher when the jump key is pressed.
- Added firing.
- Added stats menu in the top-left corner.
- More stuff added to the goodie pickups, including ammo.

GRAPHICS
- Made some kickass intro graphics!
- Added more Keen animations
- Added world map graphics

GENERAL
- Added company intro + edited original intro.

BAD NEWS
- I won't be implementing hanging on to walls. I'm happy with the current platform engine and don't want to mess it up. Hanging probably wouldn't be that necessary in the game anyway.



24 February 2006
ENGINE
- Firing now completely works.
- Pogo is now turned off when the player fires while pogosticking.
- Added climbing on and jumping from poles!
- Tested movement engine; passed!
- Fixed map movement bugs.
___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: tips
content:
Don't worry:
[quote]Quote:[hr]And of course, all original graphics, which I hope to add some of my own graphics too (but ONLY if they fit).[hr][/quote]

About the IMF music... I don't feel too good about those, so I'll probably be making some remixes next to the original music. Now only if I could get my hands on a soundfont pack with Keenish samples... (Otherwise, I'd still have plenty samples, but some just aren't good for Keen games).

I also mentioned this will play like the original Keen games. I shouldn't have said that, as this will be pretty different from the original games in a few aspects. It will still have the super-duper Keen feel to it, though. I hope. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

PS: If that program doesn't work out then I'd suggest using Game Maker.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: tips
content:
I know Game Maker 5, but I don't really like its interface (and limitations like MIDI only).

I have been using TGF/MMF/MMF2 for like years too, but I've grown tired of it, and things sometimes are just done too work-aroundy because it isn't flexible. So I gave up on that after trying twice.

I have about 2 years of experience with Sphere, so I know it well enough to make a platformer with it. It uses Javascript, so it's pretty flexible, and things are going fine so far.____________
I have a boring signature.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site[/url].
